section: The term of this Agreement shall continue for one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be renewed for any number of successive one (1) year terms by mutual written agreement of the parties prior to the conclusion of the term of this Agreement. A party wishing to renew this Agreement shall give the other party notice thereof no less than thirty (30) days before the expiration of the term then in effect. In the event that either party does not give such notice, the term of this Agreement shall be automatically renewed for another one (1) year.
explanation: This section contains contradictory statements regarding the renewal of the agreement. It states that the agreement may be renewed by mutual written agreement, but then it also states that the agreement will be automatically renewed if neither party provides notice of non-renewal. These statements contradict each other, as one requires active agreement while the other implies automatic renewal unless actively prevented.

section: Each party (the "Guarantor") shall protect the other party (the "Protected Party") from any and all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, specifically including legal counsel payments, that the Protected Party accrues due to external grievances resulting from the Guarantor's actions, failures, or deceptive statements, provided the Protected Party is considered a key agent of the Guarantor. Furthermore, 2TheMart will protect i-Escrow from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, inclusive of justifiable legal costs, that i-Escrow bears due to external grievances derived from 2TheMart Material. Additionally, i-Escrow will protect 2TheMart from all liabilities, damages, charges, and expenditures, including justified attorney costs, that 2TheMart bears due to external grievances arising from i-Escrow Media and/or the Deliverables provided to Patrons.
explanation: The first sentence refers to the 'Protected Party' being considered a 'key agent of the Guarantor'. This clause creates ambiguity because the typical understanding of indemnity does not include an agent relationship. The following sentences then specify direct indemnification obligations without the agent qualification, making the initial sentence unclear and potentially contradictory to the subsequent specific indemnification clauses.

section: i-Escrow shall keep for one (1) year proper records and books of account relating to the computation of advertising payments owed to 2TheMart (including, as appropriate, the computation of the size of average Transaction). Once every twelve (12) months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect and audit such records to verify reports.
explanation: The phrase 'Once every twelve (12) months' is ambiguous because it does not specify whether the twelve-month period starts from the Effective Date of the agreement, the Launch Date, or some other event. This ambiguity can lead to disputes over when 2TheMart is entitled to conduct an audit.
